properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:47AM AKST until January 12 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of 4 to 8 inches. Winds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts as high as 30
mph expected.

* WHERE...Bristol Bay; north and west of King Salmon.

* WHEN...Through 3 PM AKST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility to one half mile at
times along the Bristol Bay coast.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow totals expected north of King
Salmon. Communities along the Bristol Bay coast can expect to
see snow and blowing snow conditions slowly improve through
Sunday morning. Areas of snow and blowing snow will persist for
interior Bristol Bay locations through early afternoon as the
storm progresses eastward.
properties.instruction:
A winter weather advisory for snow and blowing snow means that
visibilities will be limited due to a combination of falling and
blowing snow. Use caution when traveling, especially in open
areas.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON NORTH AND WEST OF KING SALMON
